page.title: 06WRITTLE COUNTY JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: Writtle County Junior School was opened in September 1963.It replaced the old junior and infant schools which were housed in the buildings which are now the village library and the Christian Centre. When the new school was first opened it was a primary school, but in 1968 aseparate infant school was built. Over the years the primary school population has steadily declined and is still declining.At the moment there are 240 children in the junior school divided into eight classes. A new headmistress, Mrs. S.M. Fitzpatrick, was appointed in April 1985,after the retirement of the old headmaster,Mr.R.S.Eveleigh,who had been head since the opening of the school in 1963.
